summary: This is an email chain between a U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor and law enforcement agents discussing the status of FBI 302 interview reports and handwritten notes for the Epstein case. The correspondence reveals the extensive scale of the investigation, referencing over 120 interviews, and involves coordination to ensure all documentation is accounted for.

persons.name: Keven
persons.context: Listed at the top of an interview document; was present for an interview with another individual.

connections.description: Working together to compile and review FBI 302 interview reports and notes for the Epstein case investigation.

events.title: Interview regarding Epstein case
events.description: An interview was conducted; the corresponding FBI 302 report is noted as being very short, and the presence of handwritten notes is questioned.

keyFacts: The document reveals the investigation involved 'more than 120 interviews', indicating its extensive scope.
There is meticulous coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and law enforcement agents to account for all FBI 302 reports and corresponding handwritten interview notes.
The correspondence highlights specific gaps in documentation, such as missing notes for certain interviews or very short 302 reports.
The email chain is focused on administrative review and completeness of investigative records, not on the substantive content of the interviews.
